item.title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to simplify and rename the H-2C worker program, and for other purposes.
To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to simplify and rename the H-2C worker program, and for other purposes.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 117 (Friday, July 12, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CRAWFORD:H.R. 3740.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I of the U.S. Constitution[Page H5775]
bill.title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to simplify and rename the H-2C worker program, and for other purposes.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary, and in addition to the Committees on Energy and Commerce, and Education and Labor, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
